input_data.title: Year of the Rabbit
input_data.overview: Set in the dark heart of Victorian London, Detective Inspector Rabbit is a hardened booze-hound who's seen it all. Rabbit's been chasing bad guys for as long as he can remember, but these days his heart keeps stopping at inopportune moments.

response.analytical_summary: Year of the Rabbit is a darkly comedic crime drama set in Victorian London, blending procedural elements with absurdist humor and action sequences. The series follows Detective Inspector Rabbit, a flawed and cynical investigator grappling with personal demons and supernatural encounters. It offers a unique tonal mix, combining gritty realism with fantastical elements and a satirical take on the Victorian era. The show explores themes of justice, morality, and redemption through the lens of a troubled protagonist navigating a world of crime and the occult.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Detective Inspector Rabbit, a hardened and alcoholic investigator, reluctantly partnered with Zelda, a mystical constable, to solve crimes in a fantastical Victorian London. Early cases involve a series of bizarre murders and conspiracies that lead them deeper into the city's underbelly. Rabbit's past as a soldier and his ongoing struggles with mortality are gradually revealed, impacting his ability to solve cases and maintain his sanity. As the season progresses, a larger conspiracy emerges, involving powerful figures manipulating events from the shadows. Rabbit and Zelda uncover a plot to destabilize the city and exploit its supernatural elements for personal gain. The season culminates in a confrontation with the mastermind behind the conspiracy, forcing Rabbit to confront his own demons and make difficult choices that will shape his future and the fate of London. While the immediate threat is resolved, the series hints at ongoing supernatural forces and unresolved mysteries, setting the stage for future conflicts.
response.keyword_sentence: Year of the Rabbit blends crime investigation with supernatural mystery, offering a darkly comic and gritty portrayal of a flawed detective navigating the dangers of Victorian London.
